an1.1-10:1.1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an1.1-10:1.1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
an1.1-10:1.2.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a man’s mind like the sight of a woman.
an1.1-10:1.2.2: The sight of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:2.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a man’s mind like the sound of a woman.
an1.1-10:2.1.2: The sound of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:3.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a man’s mind like the smell of a woman.
an1.1-10:3.1.2: The smell of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:4.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a man’s mind like the taste of a woman.
an1.1-10:4.1.2: The taste of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:5.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a man’s mind like the touch of a woman.
an1.1-10:5.1.2: The touch of a woman occupies a man’s mind.”
an1.1-10:6.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sight that occupies a woman’s mind like the sight of a man.
an1.1-10:6.1.2: The sight of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
an1.1-10:7.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single sound that occupies a woman’s mind like the sound of a man.
an1.1-10:7.1.2: The sound of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
an1.1-10:8.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single smell that occupies a woman’s mind like the smell of a man.
an1.1-10:8.1.2: The smell of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
an1.1-10:9.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single taste that occupies a woman’s mind like the taste of a man.
an1.1-10:9.1.2: The taste of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
an1.1-10:10.1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single touch that occupies a woman’s mind like the touch of a man.
an1.1-10:10.1.2: The touch of a man occupies a woman’s mind.”
